alert.note: Alert for Lake (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 11:16AM CDT until April 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, APRIL 03... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...Until Monday, April 03. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, In Missouri, most fields around Robinson Lake in Pemiscot County are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.7 feet Saturday morning. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
